meanings.definition: The action of freeing someone from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
meanings.sent1: She received an exemption from jury duty due to her medical condition.
meanings.sent2: The student was granted an exemption from the final exam because of a family emergency.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to claim an exemption from cleaning its litter box, but no one was fooled.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like an exemption from the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The golden ticket was his exemption to enter the chocolate factory.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is exempt from a particular rule or requirement.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy businessman was seen as an exemption from the strict dress code.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was the only exemption allowed to skip practice that day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought it was the exemption to the 'no stealing nuts' rule.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an exemption that brightened up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The magical amulet granted him exemption from all harm.
